description: Bonheur du Jour; Attributed to Adam Weisweiler (French, 1744 - 1820, master 1778), Wedgewood plaques designed by Elizabeth, Lady Templetown (British, died 1823, designing for Wedgwood 1783 - 1787), and modeled by William Hackwood, et al; Paris, France; about 1785 - 1790; Oak and mahogany veneered with amboyna, ebony, green stained harewood, and sycamore; set with five jasperware plaques with a green ground; gilt-bronze mounts; white marble top and shelf; 107.6 x 69.2 x 41.3 cm (42 3/8 x 27 1/4 x 16 1/4 in.); 72.DA.59; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California

maker: Attributed to Adam Weisweiler, Wedgewood plaques designed by Elizabeth, Lady Templetown, and modeled by William Hackwood, et al
medium: Oak and mahogany veneered with amboyna, ebony, green stained harewood, and sycamore; set with five jasperware plaques with a green ground; gilt-bronze mounts; white marble top and shelf
